params.text:
Static analyser breaks on relative jumps

The mnemonic_counter used to map instructions to lines gets messed up
and the static analyser loses track of where it is. This bug surfaces
if there are non-mnemonic lines in an instruction block (e.g. ".mark:"
directives).

The signature of this bug is that the error report contains several
branches ("after true branch", "after false branch") and goes backwards
for the last one (usually); e.g. you get a trace for line 20, then 40,
then 80, and then suddenly for line 30.

If this bug bites you there is a simple workaround - just use labels as
jump targets.
